FAQs

Questions & Answers

Top Questions From Small Business Owners

How long does a typical project take?

Most brochure-style sites launch in 4–6 weeks. More complex builds with custom integrations can run 8–10 weeks. We map timelines in the proposal so you know what to expect.

Do you really hand-code every website?

Yes. We start with wireframes, move into design, then code everything in HTML/CSS/JS. No WordPress, no page builders. It keeps your site lean, fast, and secure.

What’s included in the $175/mo plan?

You get design, development, hosting, SSL, unlimited edits, analytics setup, and proactive maintenance. It’s the easiest way to keep your site running without hiring in-house.

Can I cancel the monthly plan?

There’s a 12-month agreement to cover the initial build. After that, you can move to a maintenance-only plan, continue as-is, or switch to an on-demand engagement.

What if I already have a website?

We’ll audit what you’ve got, figure out what’s working, and rebuild the rest from the ground up. Most clients see improved load times, better conversions, and happier visitors.

Do you offer SEO or Google Ads support?

Absolutely. We bake in on-page SEO during development and can manage ongoing SEO + Google Ads campaigns so your site actually gets traffic.

Will I be able to make updates after launch?

Yes—send edits over and we take care of them. If you want to handle updates yourself, we’ll provide documentation or lightweight CMS options to keep things moving.

How many pages are included?

Most starter sites include up to five fully designed pages. Need more? We’ll scope additional pages or landing pages as part of the proposal so pricing stays transparent.

What content do I need to provide?

We can work from your existing copy or collaborate on messaging. We’ll guide you on photography, brand voice, and key selling points to make sure every page resonates.

Do you work with businesses outside Dallas?

Yes—we partner with clients across the U.S. and Canada. Everything can be handled via Zoom, Loom, and shared project spaces so distance is never a blocker.

| Rocinante Marketing

Hand-coded, lightweight websites for small businesses across the US & Canada. Fast, maintainable, and built to convert.
